item.title: half life expansions
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Thank you. About time this thread was made.

Opposing Force is okay as a game, though Race-X was retarded. Regardless, they added new weapons, new environments, the story was familiar yet somehow felt different (in a good way), and it had a few moments of nostalgia from Half-Life.
The biggest problem, however, isn’t really about the game itself but rather the rabid fanbase of the most overrated character in the history of video games (yes, that includes Master Chief)… Adrian Shephard.
How this generic, uninteresting, unoriginal, and boring character got so popular is beyond me, but it has to stop. Some people came up with insane theories that he was in Portal. And now they want him back in Episode 3. I swear I will uninstall it as soon as I see him if he’s really in the game! Thankfully, I know Valve isn’t that retarded.
Oh, and there’s that one bug in “We Are Not Alone” that makes the game crash after you open the door. It still isn’t fixed as far as I know. You have to no clip and gently move around to make sure you don’t look at the glowing ball that Gordon jumps into.

But the biggest piece of shit is a blue one, ie Blue Shit, also known as Blue Shift by a few unfun people. The game is basically Half-Life, but shorter and shity-er.
There are no new weapons (hell, a few of them were removed), the environments sucked, the puzzles weren’t as clever or fun, and the ending was a joke!

So, yeah. Fuck you Gearbox. Randy Pitchford has no right to talk shit about Valve.
